settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH_POWER enables the use of arm topology power functions instead of generic ones.
checkbox.name: ARCH_POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH_POWER

settingsPane.description: The following settings control CPU hotplug parameters. Depending on the following parameters, the second core is enabled or disabled.
settingsPane.name: CPU Hotplug Settings

seekBar.description: second core will be enabled when the load goes above this threshold (default is 30)
seekBar.name: load_h0

seekBar.description: second core will be disabled when the load goes below this threshold (default is 20)
seekBar.name: load_l1

seekBar.description: Sets hot plug sampling intervals for screen-on state (default is 100)
seekBar.name: rate

seekBar.description: Sets the frequency below which second core will not be turned on, regardless of thresholds. (default: 100000)
seekBar.name: freq_min

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. AFTR+LPA is the default and best for the battery life but if you have problems try Idle+LPA.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency Settings. Normally, our device has 2 frequency steps. SiyahKernel has three steps but the third step is not enabled as default. The defaults are 160,267 and 267. Voltage defaults are 950mV, 1000mV and 1000mV.
settingsPane.name: GPUFreq

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second (middle) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third (last) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 950,1050 and 1050.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first (lowest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second (middle) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third (highest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps. The third step is disabled as default by having the second to third threshold 100.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

settingsPane.description: The number of cycles that the GPU stays at the specific level. The defaults are 1,1 and 1.
settingsPane.name: GPU StayCount

seekBar.description: GPU first (for the lowest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount1

seekBar.description: GPU second (for the middle freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount2

seekBar.description: GPU third (for the highest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount3

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs restart)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

spinner.description: This will set the suspend frequency used in ondemand governor to have ondemandX behaviour. This will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps and only effective while ondemand governor is in use.
spinner.name: Default Ondemand Suspend Freq.

spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for those period, then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
